DOC.brief_summary: The purpose of this study is to describe the postoperative outcomes after laparoscopic transperitoneal nephrectomy and compare them with hand assisted laparoscopic nephrectomy with a focus on the limiting factors that prevent an ambulatory nephrectomy, and the benefit of our experiences from the previous study to optimize the postoperative outcomes.
DOC.brief_title: Laparoscopic Versus Hand Assisted Laparoscopic Trans-peritoneal Laparoscopic Nephrectomy as One Day Surgery (i.e.: Are There Differences in Postoperative Outcome / Convalescence)
DOC.criteria: Inclusion criteria: 1. Patient between 2580 years old. 2. Diagnosed as Cancer Renis 3. Can read and understand Danish 4. No cardiac disease lead to close cardiologic observations 5. Any T, any N any M stadia. Exclusion criteria: 1. Mentally sick patient 2. Dement 3. Living alone 4. Cardiac problem 5. Per operative bleeding with the need to blood transfusion 6. Operation time at afternoon
